subject: Investing
title: Synthetic vs. Physical ETFs
description: A quick, practical guide to Synthetic vs. Physical ETFs.

hook.text: Physical ETFs buy the actual stocks. Synthetic ETFs use swap contracts with banks to mimic returns.

buildup.text: Physical replication is simple: the fund owns every stock in the index, weighted correctly.

discovery.text: Synthetic ETFs can track hard-to-access markets cheaply. They skip buying thousands of small stocks.

twist.text: The catch: synthetic ETFs carry counterparty risk. If the swap provider defaults, returns can vanish.

climax.text: After the 2008 crisis, regulators tightened rules on synthetics. Collateral requirements rose sharply.

punchline.text: Physical owns the real thing. Synthetic trusts a promise.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of synthetic ETFs?
options: They charge no fees at all
